content: ightPlan.xml.<FlightNumber airlineIATACode="#"...>` = Flight Leg Data Model `carrier` * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.<FlightNumber...number="#"...>` = Flight Leg Data Model `flightNumber` * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.<FlightNumber...operationalSuffix="#">` = Flight Leg Data Model `suffix` * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.<DepartureAirport><AirportIATACode>` = Flight Leg Data Model `departureAirport` * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.<ArrivalAirport><AirportIATACode>` = Flight Leg Data Model `arrivalAirport` * Flight Leg Data Model `statusCode` <> “CNL“ and “DEL“ * When records exist in the Flight Plan Alternative Airport Data Model for the `legId` being processed from the Operation Flight Plan file, the `status`(see Mapping for details) of the associated Alternative Airports' records is updated to “CANCELLED” for the corresponding `legId`. * When `type` is “Alternative Departure Airport”, `ATCFlightPlan.xml` file is parsed and attributes are assigned. * Station ICAO Code information is assigned to Flight Plan Alternative Airport records through the `<AtcMessageDetails>` element. * Station IATA Code information is assigned to Flight Plan Alternative Airport records is retrieved from the RiverX Station Data Model using the values mapped according to the following conditions; * `ATCFlightPlan.xml.<FlightPlanAtcIcao>.<AtcMessageDetails>.<Items>.<Item18>.<TALT>###</TALT>` = Station Data Model `icao` then retrieve Station Data Model `stationId` * When `type` is “EFB Alternative Arrival Airport”, `ATCFlightPlan.xml` file is parsed and attributes are assigned. * Station ICAO Code information is assigned to Flight Plan Alternative Airport records through the `<AtcMessageDetails>` element. * Station IATA Code information is assigned to Flight Plan Alternative Airport records is retrieved from the RiverX Station Data Model using the values mapped according to the following conditions; * `<FlightPlanAtcIcao>.<AtcMessageDetails>.<Items>.<Item16...alternateAirport="###"/>` = Station Data Model `icao` then retrieve Station
